definitions: having the deep purple or violet color characteristic of amethyst gemstones
examples: She wore an amethyst dress to the formal dinner
The sunset turned the sky an amethyst shade

definitions: having a friendly and pleasant manner that makes others feel comfortable
examples: The amiable host made everyone feel welcome at the party
Her amiable personality helped her make friends quickly

definitions: characterized by friendly goodwill and absence of discord between parties
examples: They reached an amicable agreement after weeks of negotiation
Despite their divorce, they maintained an amicable relationship

definitions: not quite right or inappropriate in a given situation or context
examples: Something seemed amiss when the usually punctual employee arrived late
A polite reminder wouldn't go amiss at this point

definitions: affected by partial or total loss of memory due to injury or psychological trauma
examples: The amnesiac patient couldn't remember events from the past year
After the accident, he remained amnesiac for several weeks

definitions: behaving in an uncontrolled and disruptive way causing damage or disturbance
examples: The children ran amok in the playground after lunch
When the supervisor left, productivity went amok

definitions: showing, feeling, or relating to sexual desire or romantic love
examples: He whispered amorous words in her ear during dinner
The couple's amorous behavior made other guests uncomfortable

definitions: without a clearly defined shape, form, or structure in physical or conceptual terms
examples: The amorphous blob of clay awaited the sculptor's touch
Their business plan was still amorphous and needed refinement

definitions: relating to creatures that can live both on land and in water naturally
examples: The amphibian habitat included both pond and shore areas
Scientists studied the amphibian species native to the wetlands

definitions: capable of operating or living both on land and in water effectively
examples: The military used amphibious vehicles for the beach landing
The resort offered amphibious tours of the coastal region

definitions: enough or more than enough in size, scope, or capacity for purpose
examples: The auditorium provided ample seating for all attendees
She gave herself ample time to complete the project

definitions: feeling or showing that something is funny or entertaining in a pleasant way
examples: She seemed amused by his attempts to speak French
The teacher was not amused by the students' prank

definitions: causing laughter or providing entertainment through humor or unexpected elements
examples: His amusing stories kept the children entertained for hours
She found the situation more amusing than frustrating

definitions: relating to or promoting the metabolic processes that build up body tissues and muscle
examples: Athletes sometimes abuse anabolic steroids to build muscle mass
The body's anabolic processes are most active during sleep

definitions: belonging to a period other than that being portrayed or chronologically misplaced in time
examples: The film's anachronistic use of modern slang ruined the historical accuracy
Using a typewriter today seems anachronistic in the digital age

definitions: relating to or requiring an absence of oxygen for life or metabolic processes
examples: Anaerobic bacteria thrive in oxygen-free environments like deep soil
Weight lifting is primarily an anaerobic exercise

definitions: inducing insensitivity to pain through drugs or other methods before medical procedures
examples: The dentist applied anaesthetic gel before the injection
Some plants have natural anaesthetic properties

definitions: acting to relieve pain without causing loss of consciousness or other sensation
examples: The doctor prescribed analgesic medication for her back pain
Many over-the-counter drugs have analgesic properties

definitions: using continuous physical variables rather than discrete digital values
having similar features or being comparable to something else in certain respects
examples: The old analog clock still kept perfect time
Vinyl records use analog technology to reproduce sound
The heart is often used as an analog for a pump
This situation is analog to what happened last year

definitions: relating to or using comparison between similar things to explain or clarify concepts
examples: Her analogical reasoning helped students understand complex concepts
The philosopher used analogical arguments to support his theory

definitions: similar or comparable to something else in significant ways though different in others
examples: The wings of birds and bats are analogous structures
This process is analogous to how computers store information

definitions: using continuous physical variables rather than discrete digital values
having similar features or being comparable to something else in certain respects
examples: The engineer preferred analogue instruments for their precision
Scientists studied analogue recording methods
The protein serves as an analogue to the natural enzyme
This medieval tale has many analogue versions

definitions: relating to or using analysis or logical reasoning to understand complex issues
examples: Her analytic approach helped solve the complex problem
The course develops students' analytic skills

definitions: relating to the detailed examination of elements or structure to understand something better
examples: The scientist's analytical mind helped her discover new patterns
The report required strong analytical thinking

definitions: having been examined methodically and in detail to understand or explain something
examples: The carefully analyzed data revealed surprising trends
All samples were analyzed before reaching conclusions

definitions: lacking a governing body or authority resulting in disorder and confusion
examples: The classroom became anarchic when the teacher stepped out
The country fell into an anarchic state after the government collapsed

definitions: relating to the bodily structure of humans, animals, or other living organisms
examples: The medical student studied anatomic diagrams of the heart
Surgeons require detailed anatomic knowledge

definitions: relating to the structure of living things, especially the human body and its parts
examples: The anatomical model showed all major organs in detail
Her anatomical drawings were remarkably accurate

definitions: belonging to, inherited from, or denoting ancestors from previous generations
examples: They returned to their ancestral home in Ireland
The tribe still practices ancestral rituals

definitions: providing necessary support to primary activities or services in a subordinate capacity
examples: The hospital expanded its ancillary services like physical therapy
Ancillary staff helped prepare the conference venue

definitions: performed at a moderately slow walking pace in musical compositions
examples: The pianist played the andante movement with gentle expression
The composer marked the second section andante

definitions: having both masculine and feminine characteristics in appearance or behavior
examples: The model's androgynous look appealed to many fashion designers
They preferred an androgynous style of clothing

definitions: based on personal accounts rather than facts or research, often unreliable as evidence
examples: The treatment's effectiveness was only supported by anecdotal evidence
Her presentation included several anecdotal stories from patients

definitions: lacking in color, spirit, vitality, or forcefulness in appearance or effect
suffering from anemia with insufficient red blood cells or hemoglobin
examples: The company's anemic sales figures disappointed investors
His anemic response failed to address their concerns
The patient appeared pale and anemic after the surgery
Blood tests confirmed she was severely anemic

definitions: inducing insensitivity to pain through drugs or other methods before medical procedures
examples: The surgeon waited for the anesthetic effect to begin
Local anesthetic cream numbed the injection site

definitions: having the qualities of an angel such as beauty, purity, or kindness
examples: The child's angelic face masked her mischievous nature
Her angelic voice filled the cathedral with music

definitions: made to feel strong displeasure or hostility toward someone or something
examples: The angered crowd demanded answers from officials
She was visibly angered by the unfair criticism

definitions: placed or directed at an angle rather than straight or perpendicular
examples: The angled roof helped rain water run off easily
She sat at an angled position to see the screen better

definitions: experiencing or expressing severe mental or physical pain and suffering
examples: Her anguished cries echoed through the hospital corridor
The mother's anguished face showed her deep concern

definitions: having angles or sharp corners rather than curves in shape or design
examples: The building's angular architecture stood out downtown
His angular features gave him a distinguished appearance

definitions: characteristic of or resembling an animal in behavior, nature, or physical qualities
examples: His animalistic growl frightened the intruders away
The dancer's animalistic movements captivated the audience

definitions: having life or showing signs of life through movement and activity
examples: Scientists debate whether viruses are truly animate beings
The puppet seemed almost animate in the skilled performer's hands

definitions: full of life, activity, or excitement in manner or appearance
made using animation techniques to create moving images from drawings or models
examples: The animated discussion continued well past midnight
Her animated gestures emphasized every point
The children loved the new animated movie
Computer graphics created stunning animated sequences

definitions: giving life, energy, or enthusiasm to something making it active or lively
examples: Her animating presence lifted everyone's spirits
The animating principle behind the movement was social justice

definitions: relating to the belief that natural objects and phenomena have souls or spirits
examples: The tribe's animist beliefs shaped their relationship with nature
Animist traditions still influence modern cultural practices

definitions: relating to the religious belief that natural objects possess souls or spiritual essence
examples: Their animistic worldview treated every tree as sacred
The culture's animistic practices honored natural spirits

definitions: destroyed utterly and completely so that nothing remains or can be recovered
examples: The hurricane annihilated entire neighborhoods along the coast
Their hopes were annihilated by the unexpected news

definitions: causing complete destruction or defeat leaving nothing remaining or functional
examples: The army's annihilating attack left no resistance
Her annihilating critique demolished his argument

definitions: made known publicly or formally through official statements or declarations
examples: The announced changes will take effect next month
Only announced visitors are allowed past security

definitions: feeling or showing slight anger or irritation about something bothersome
examples: She was annoyed by the constant interruptions
His annoyed expression warned others to stay away
